paragraphs.text: The Observer view on the Paris attacks.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Last week's attack on Charlie Hebdo magazine in Paris and the subsequent, linked hostage-taking at a Jewish supermarket were appalling acts of inhumanity that should be universally condemned
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Despite the killers' grandiose claim to be "defenders of the prophet", their actions amounted to cold-blooded murder of defenceless people
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Their pre-planned purpose was to terrorise, divide and dismay
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Their aim was cowardly, contemptible and cruel
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The perpetrators deserve only ignominy and the bitter scorn of the world
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The attacks should be understood, more broadly, as a crude attempt to stifle a publication and its journalists
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who exercised, in vivid, unapologetic terms, the fundamental, priceless right to freedom of speech and expression
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This right, though never absolute, was established through centuries of struggle and is still far from fully accepted around the world
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There are many others - governments, dictators, religious fanatics - who would also like to shoot it down
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That the killers' made Jews their additional, parallel target lends a woefully familiar, disgustingly antisemitic twist to a three-day trail of carnage and grief
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: By so doing, they hoped yet another community would be left in fear
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This attack was thus also an attack on the French nation as a whole, on the values and beliefs that have sustained it, and on the message of liberty, equality and fraternity it has unevenly but persistently propagated
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: while
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: its principal victims were irreverent secularists
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it was also an attack on faith - an offence against moral as well as human law
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It was an attack on the life spiritual itself, whether conducted through church, mosque, synagogue or personal observance.
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: It was an act of utter godlessness
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: By attempting to murder love with fear, to kill laughter with hatred, to substitute inflexible dogmas for shared truths, the masked gunmen attacked us all
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: European, American and Arab, Muslim, Christian and Jew, black, brown and white alike
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In doing so, they posed a vital question
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: How, in the face of this assault on our common home, our common humanity, do we respond?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Do we meet terror with a greater terror of our own or do we seek another way?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Shall we unite together or shall we give in to division, discrimination and distrust?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In Paris, and in other cities around the world, a spontaneous reply has already been given
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The marchers, demonstrators, office workers, journalists, bloggers, politicians and governments who declared, with one voice:"Je suis Charlie", sent an immediate, welcome message of solidarity and defiance
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Today, this roar of courage and belief will reach ear-splitting levels
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: when
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: people from every background join a march in Paris for unity, freedom and democracy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Out of blood and horror a unique moment has arisen, for France and all Europe
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The choice is stark and unavoidable
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is between the ongoing struggle for enlightenment - Europe's gift to the world - and a gathering, hate-filled darkness
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The evident danger is that this spirit of unity may not endure
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: French Muslim leaders have roundly condemned the attackers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "These men are criminals... For me, they are not Muslims," said the imam of Drancy
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: But at less emotional moments, French Muslims also speak of routine, entrenched discrimination, of insensitive restrictions such as curbs on women wearing the veil, and of a French policy of assimilation and integration, the flipside of Britain's let- it-all-hang-out multiculturalism
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: which has failed to achieve equal rights and equal treatment
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is this same embattled Muslim community, fractured, underprivileged, marginalised and disrespected which produced the killers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is clear, conversely, that many French people have a problem with Islam
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: According to an Ipsos survey last year, 63% of French voters said Islam was not compatible with French values
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Almost three-quarters said Muslims wanted to impose their values on others
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Surveys also suggest seven out of 10 voters believe sections of the immigrant community have failed to integrate over the past 30 years
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Some 65% say immigration levels are out of control
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Anti-Muslim and anti-immigration movements are growing in strength in Germany, Britain and across Europe
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But France's already powerful far-right Front National is certain to use the Charlie Hebdo affair to exploit these fears and prejudices
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The urgent, daunting challenge for President Francois Hollande's ruling socialists, and the centre-right of former President Nicolas Sarkozy, is to plot a different, more conciliatory path
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Their task: to tap into this spirit of unity, forging a new reality for both majority and minority communities
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Muslim world leaders can help halt the cycles of violence and confrontation
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they wish
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But this common challenge will not be assisted by wrong-headed, kneejerk reactions by western security services
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In France, there is justified criticism that the Kouachi brothers were not under close watch, given their past record of extremism
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Yet it would be wrong to massively increase monitoring of the Muslim community
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: thereby exacerbating existing tensions
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Much better to use any additional resources to engage, rather than confront
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: , while focusing more exactly on identifying truly hardline fanatics
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Similarly
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: calls for more cash to counter a mounting but undefined terrorist menace to Britain should be treated with both respect and circumspection
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Andrew Parker, head of MI5, warned last week of the "growing gap between the increasingly challenging threat and the decreasing availability of capabilities to address it"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: But extended, intrusive internet surveillance does not necessarily bring increased security
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What it does do is potentially deal a further blow to personal liberty, including the ability to speak and communicate freely and openly
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The response to the Charlie Hebdo killings, in the longer term, should also include wider acceptance of the proper limits to individual and social freedoms, including free speech
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is not acceptable, for example, to use racist terms to describe a different ethnic group
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: It is not acceptable to resort to stereotypes to vilify minorities or
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: say, members of the opposite sex
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: And it is sometimes not appropriate, nor particularly funny, to deliberately provoke Muslims by publishing cartoons of the prophet that they view as blasphemous, offensive and insulting
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: Having said that, individuals or groups should not seek to prevent or ban published material just because they do not like it, do not agree or do not get the joke
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Even more so, the ridiculing of Islam, however much resented, cannot be used to justify or explain gross acts of violence
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The freedom to speak, write, draw and laugh fearlessly, without censorship and unreasonable restraint, lies at the very heart of a tolerant, democratic and inclusive society
paragraphs.label: assumption
